content: I was born in Liverpool, England in 1970. I studied pure & applied physics at the University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology (UMIST) and graduated with a BSc (I:hons) in 1992. I obtained a PhD in applied mathematics in 1996 from the Mathematics Institute of Saint Andrews University, Scotland. I have 15 years postgraduate research experience in the fields of Earth observation and remote sensing. I am currently a member of the European Geosciences Union and the Royal Statistical Society and am doing a postdoc in the Department of Meteorology at the University of Reading where I work for the Horizon 2020 FIDUCEO project.
